# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = [""]
    for word in split(text)
        if (length(lines[end]) + length(word) + 1) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        lines[end] *= " $word"
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer nec odio. Praesent libero. Sed cursus ante dapibus diam. Sed nisi. Nulla quis sem at nibh elementum imperdiet. Duis sagittis ipsum. Praesent mauris. Fusce nec tellus sit amet sem."

println(wrap_string(text, 20))
```

This function will split the text into words and then add a new line every time adding another word would exceed the specified `text_width`. The example above uses a default width of 10 characters per line.
